snippet: In 1990, 13 artworks — including Rembrandts, a Vermeer and a Manet — were stolen from the Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum in Boston. A quarter-century later, the hunt continues.
abstract: Artworks stolen from Boston's Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum in 1990, including Rembrandt painting Christ in the Storm on the Sea of Galilee, are still missing as 25th anniversary of robbery approaches; FBI investigators still hope to recover works, though most of their suspects are already dead.
lead_paragraph: In 1990, 13 artworks — including Rembrandts, a Vermeer and a Manet — were stolen from the Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum in Boston. A quarter-century later, the hunt continues.

headline.main: Isabella Stewart Gardner Heist: 25 Years of Theories
headline.print_headline: Still Missing After All These Years
